Recommended Reason: UNESCO World Heritage temple with National Treasures including stone pagodas and potential buried offerings
Supporting Evidence: 8th century Silla temple designated as National Treasure, repository of Buddhist artifacts and architectural treasures

Recommended Reason: Silla royal tomb with documented gold crown and gilt-bronze artifacts, potential for undiscovered chambers
Supporting Evidence: Archaeological excavation revealed gold crown, saddle flap with heavenly horse painting, designated National Treasures

Recommended Reason: Ancient Baekje kingdom capital with gilt-bronze crowns and royal burial artifacts
Supporting Evidence: Excavated tombs revealed gilt-bronze crown from Baekje period, designated as National Treasure

Recommended Reason: Houses the Tripitaka Koreana, complete Buddhist scriptures on 81,258 wooden blocks, designated National Treasure
Supporting Evidence: 13th century complete Buddhist canon preserved on wooden printing blocks, UNESCO World Heritage site

Recommended Reason: 8th century Buddhist cave temple with stone Buddha statue and guardian figures, potential for ritual deposits
Supporting Evidence: UNESCO World Heritage artificial grotto with stone Buddha and bodhisattva statues, designated National Treasure
